Cierre del peso mexicano. |url=http://www.pesomexicano.com.mx/archivo/2010/junio/03/reporte-jueves-3-de-junio-del-2010--cierre-del-peso-mexicano.htm#leermas |publisher=www.pesomexicano.com.mx |accessdate=August 10, 2010}}
}} '''Nayarit''' ({{IPA-es|naÊaËÉ¾it}}) officially ''Estado Libre y Soberano de Nayarit'' ({{lang-en|Free and Sovereign State of Nayarit}}) is one of the 31 states which, with the [[Mexico City|Federal District]], comprise the [[Political divisions of Mexico|32 Federal Entities]] of [[Mexico]]. It is divided in [[Municipalities of Nayarit|20 municipalities]] and its capital city is [[Tepic]]. It is located in [[Western Mexico]]. It is bordered by the states of [[Sinaloa]] to the northwest, [[Durango]] to the north, [[Zacatecas]] to the northeast and [[Jalisco]] to the south. To the west, Nayarit has a significant share of coastline on the [[Pacific Ocean]]. Besides the mainland, the islands [[Islas Marias|Marias]], Isabel, [[Islas Tres Marietas|Tres Marietas]] and FarallÃ³n La PeÃ±a in the [[Pacific Ocean]] are part of its territory. == Geography == Nayarit covers {{convert|27815|km2|sqmi|sp=us}}, making it one of the smaller states of Mexico.[http://www.elbalero.gob.mx/kids/explora/html/nayarit/orografia.html Gov Mx] Nayarit is located between latitude lines 23Â°05' north and 20Â°36' south and longitude lines 103Â°43' east and 105Â°46' west.[http://mapserver.inegi.gob.mx/geografia/espanol/estados/nay/ubic_geo.cfm?c=442&e=18&CFID=1633637&CFTOKEN=14686722 Map Gov Mx] Its terrain is broken up by the western ends of the [[Sierra Madre Occidental]] mountains. Its highest mountains are: San Juan, [[SanguangÃ¼ey]], [[El Ceboruco]], [[Cumbre de Pajaritos]] and [[Picachos]].[http://www.infoplease.com/ce6/world/A0835046.html InfoPlease] Nayarit has two volcanoes, [[Ceboruco]] and [[SangangÃ¼ey]]. In the northeast are broad, tropical plains watered by the [[RÃ­o Grande de Santiago]], a continuation of the [[Lerma River]]. The main state rivers are the RÃ­o Grande de Santiago, San Pedro, [[Acaponeta]], [[RÃ­o Ameca|Ameca]] and [[RÃ­o Las CaÃ±as|Las CaÃ±as]]. The last two also form natural boundaries with the states of [[Jalisco]] and [[Sinaloa]], respectively. Nayarit also has several lagoons such as pito the [[Santa MarÃ­a del Oro, Nayarit|Santa MarÃ­a del Oro]], [[San Pedro Lagunillas]] and [[Agua Brava]].[http://www.inegi.gob.mx/est/default.aspx?c=4334&e=18 Gov Mx] {| class="wikitable" |- ! Religion ! Percent ! Population of Tepic - 295,2040 |- | Catholic | align=right | 91.8% | align=right | 238,579 |- | Protestant Evangelical | align=right | 3% | align=right | 24,313 |- | Biblical Non-Evangelical | align=right | 1.3% | align=right | 10, 535 |- | Not Religious | align=right | 2.9% | align=right | 23, 607 |} [[Tepic]] is home to the [[Catedral de la PurÃ­sima ConcepciÃ³n]] or Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception.[http://www.gcatholic.com/churches/data/cathMX.htm Churches Mx] == Education == *[[Instituto TecnolÃ³gico de Tepic]] *[[Universidad AutÃ³noma de Nayarit]] *[[Universidad TecnÃ³logica de Nayarit]] *[[Universidad TecnÃ³logica de la Costa]] *[[Escuela Normal Superior de Nayarit]] *[[Escuela Secundaria Tecnica Numero 51. (Emilio M. Gonzales)]] == Agriculture == A variety of products are able to be produced in Nayarit due to its variable geography and climate. Volcanic soil, heavy rains and many altitude variations due to the mountains allow for the diverse crops. The crops include [[grain]], [[sugarcane]], [[cotton]], [[coffee]], and [[tobacco]]. Forest wealth is also taken advantage of and cattle raising is also important.[http://www.commonborders.org/nayarit1999.htm Common Borders] == Economy == Nayarit depends heavily on natural resources and agriculture to support their economy.[http://www.encyclopedia.com/doc/1E1-Nayarit.html Encyclopedia] Cash crops such as [[mangos]], [[coffee]], [[tobacco]] and [[sugar cane]] are staples in the economy. Mining is a significant industry, due to large deposits of [[lead]], [[copper]], [[silver]], and [[gold]] in the Nayarit area. There is also a fishing industry in Nayarit, but it is not as major as the mining or agricultural industries. In recent years, Nayarit has worked to build its tourism sector, marketing the "[[Riviera Nayarita]]" as a safe, beautiful destination served by Puerto Vallarta International Airport. As a result, it ranked second in tourism investment in Mexico in 2008, was featured in North American tourism websites in Winter 2008-09,{{cite news| url=http://www.reuters.com/article/pressRelease/idUS154403+04-Mar-2009+PRN20090304 | work=Reuters | title=Nayarit, Mexico - Strong in Tourism Growth, Investment, Job Generation and Safety | date=March 4, 2009}} and was the setting for the U.S. MTV reality competition [[Gauntlet 3|"The Gauntlet 3"]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/shows/rwrr_challenge/gauntlet_3/series.jhtml|title=The Gauntlet III at mtv.com|accessdate=2010-11-01}} == Municipalities == Nayarit is divided into 20 [[Municipality|municipalities]] ''([[Municipio (Mexico)|municipios]])''.
